channel.title: NPR Programs: Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Martínez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: European leaders to meet for emergency summit about the U.S. and Greenland
item.description: European leaders will gather in Brussels Thursday night for an emergency meeting on tensions with the U.S. over Greenland and President Trump's tariff threats.
item.content:encoded: European leaders will gather in Brussels Thursday night for an emergency meeting on tensions with the U.S. over Greenland and President Trump's tariff threats.
item.dc:creator: Teri Schultz

item.title: Former U.S. ambassador discusses the path forward after Trump's Davos speech
item.description: NPR's A Martinez speaks with Alan Leventhal, a former U.S. ambassador to Denmark, about developments following President Trump's speech in Davos.
item.content:encoded: NPR's A Martinez speaks with Alan Leventhal, a former U.S. ambassador to Denmark, about developments following President Trump's speech in Davos.
item.dc:creator: A Martínez

item.title: Rahm Emanuel critiques Democrats and offers advice for the upcoming midterms
item.description: NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks with longtime Democrat Rahm Emanuel about politics in the Trump era.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks with longtime Democrat Rahm Emanuel about politics in the Trump era.
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: Jack Smith defends Trump investigations to House Republicans
item.description: Jack Smith's appearance before the House Judiciary Committee marked the first open testimony about his work after presiding over two federal criminal indictments of President Trump.
item.content:encoded:
Jack Smith's appearance before the House Judiciary Committee marked the first open testimony about his work after presiding over two federal criminal indictments of President Trump.

(Image credit: Chip Somodevilla)
item.dc:creator: Carrie Johnson

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: European leaders to meet for emergency summit about the U.S. and Greenland, Trump's statements about Greenland threaten long-standing world order, SCOTUS weighs Trump's power to fire Fed governors.
item.content:encoded: European leaders to meet for emergency summit about the U.S. and Greenland, Trump's statements about Greenland threaten long-standing world order, SCOTUS weighs Trump's power to fire Fed governors.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: Massive winter storm predicted to hit large swath of the U.S. this weekend
item.description: Snow and possibly icy conditions are forecasted for several Southern states, including Texas, this weekend.
item.content:encoded: Snow and possibly icy conditions are forecasted for several Southern states, including Texas, this weekend.
item.dc:creator: Lucio Vasquez

item.title: 'Sinners' makes history with 16 Oscar nominations
item.description: Nominations for the 98th Academy Awards were announced early Thursday, including a new category debuting this year.
item.content:encoded: Nominations for the 98th Academy Awards were announced early Thursday, including a new category debuting this year.
item.dc:creator: Mandalit del Barco

item.title: Investigation links several of Trump's associates to mining interests in Greenland
item.description: As President Trump pursues a takeover of Greenland, an investigation links several of his associates to mining interests in the Arctic territory. NPR's Leila Fadel speaks with journalist Kevin Hall.
item.content:encoded: As President Trump pursues a takeover of Greenland, an investigation links several of his associates to mining interests in the Arctic territory. NPR's Leila Fadel speaks with journalist Kevin Hall.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: Supreme Court weighs whether Trump has the power to fire Federal Reserve governors
item.description: President Trump wants much lower interest rates, and he's going to extraordinary lengths to push the Federal Reserve in that direction. Trump's efforts are now being tested by the Supreme Court.
item.content:encoded: President Trump wants much lower interest rates, and he's going to extraordinary lengths to push the Federal Reserve in that direction. Trump's efforts are now being tested by the Supreme Court.
item.dc:creator: Scott Horsley

item.title: Takeaways from the Supreme Court hearing on president's power to fire Fed governors
item.description: As the Supreme Court considers whether to allow President Trump to remove Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook, NPR discusses takeaways from Wednesday's oral arguments with Amy Howe of SCOTUSblog.
item.content:encoded: As the Supreme Court considers whether to allow President Trump to remove Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook, NPR discusses takeaways from Wednesday's oral arguments with Amy Howe of SCOTUSblog.
item.dc:creator: A Martínez
